segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Evening in Dol-Makjar, a crisp, cool night. Footsteps approach. A seedy tavern in The Fray, the lowermost neighborhood of the city. Noise of shattering glass bottles in nearby alleyways, raucous shouts, fights breaking out, loud music. The rein of a nearby horse as a carriage trundles down the street, sputtering torchlight, casting shadows long and wide through the city streets. Humble sign of a tavern. Potter's Field, the symbol of a nameless gravestone on its sign. A few drunken reprobates outside. In what state does Bolaire approach this place?
segments.summary: Evening scene-setting in Dol-Makjar's seedy neighborhood The Fray, outside Potter's Field tavern
segments.location: The Fray, outside Potter's Field tavern

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Bolaire has their hood closed, the cape closed and the hood up to be as inconspicuous as somebody who is wearing such a unique mask can be. He has a package, reasonably sized, wax-papered, tied with string. Clearly well put together. I mean, if you didn't know better, would look like someone had just very plainly wrapped a Christmas present. It's very creased and well-folded and together. Maybe it's a gift for someone.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes his disguised approach with a mysterious package
segments.location: The Fray, outside Potter's Field tavern

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You walk through a neighborhood so far removed from the Archanade that the odds of being recognized in this place are next to none. Door swings open. Smugglers, criminals, few people under sputtering candlelight speaking in hushed tones. Bartender looks up to perceive you, and with that eye contact, nods, communicating that no, he does not perceive you, not tonight, in any case. At the back of this humble, liquor-drenched hovel is a thick, red door, brass studs throughout it. It's hidden behind a curtain, but it's sturdier than just about anything else in here. Seated behind the curtain is a thin, reedy figure who looks up at your approach.
segments.summary: Bolaire enters Potter's Field tavern and approaches a hidden back door

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: No evil.
segments.summary: Bolaire gives a password

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Pushes his hand into the leather covering of the door. Something heavy like stone grates in a hidden hinge. The wall swings open, and for a minute, overpowering the stench of rot and ale on the floor, powerful incense, something heady, otherworldly, as you step into the shadows. You enter a hidden place of leisure behind Potter's Field. You look in and see the proprietor, Devlin, look up to you, rows and rows of bottles, crystal glassware overhead. The fixtures here: brass, velvet, of a higher caliber than that which resides in the exterior. Devlin, a brimmed hat pitched forward to cover the very top of his forehead, looks up at you. His eyes always reflect a few more candles, a few more lanterns than are ever present in this actual physical space. He looks up and goes, 'Master, pleasure to see you. Can I pour you a drink, or are you only here for a spell?'
segments.summary: Bolaire enters the hidden establishment behind Potter's Field, greeted by proprietor Devlin

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh. It's been an odd week, I think, I think a tad of something interesting would do very well. It's getting strange out there.
segments.summary: Bolaire orders a drink and comments on strange times

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: If it keeps up, might eventually get as strange as it is in here.
segments.summary: Devlin responds to Bolaire's comment about strange times

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He pours something thick and viscous. Delightful aroma, must be something sweet, like a sherry, puts it in front of you. He looks over to a corner. You see a woman wearing thick purple robes, a long cloak. She wears formless, shapeless attire, but her face is angular and beautiful. She sits, small velvet benches, an ornate lantern made of shattered, almost mosaic-like glass stained in different colors, illuminates her face. She leans forward with empathy in her eyes and understanding at a mother and daughter across from her who seem addled in their sleeplessness. Give me a perception check.
segments.summary: Devlin serves Bolaire a drink, Bolaire notices a woman in purple robes counseling distressed clients

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Let's see here. That's going to be a 19.
segments.summary: Bolaire rolls perception check

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Even at her whispered tone, your ears detect: 'Of course, of course. The concerns are as great as the problem which brought you here in the first place. Your father, your husband's soul is in the underworld. There is no afterlife that calls to it. The clerics of The Totality, perhaps some druids of the Old Path, would seek to send his soul off towards oblivion and void, or perhaps depict some uncharted course through realms beyond that only the Shapers knew, but if you wish for a brighter resting place for your father--' And here she makes eye contact with the young woman, who you can see probably hasn't slept in days; tears have crusted and dried in where they've been running down her face. She says, 'There are precious few left in this world who can help you, but there are some. There are some that wish for these souls not to be lost. Now, our help does not come cheaply, but it is reliable.' You see a vellum contract moved across the table to the young woman who begins to read the text.
segments.summary: Bolaire overhears conversation about souls in the underworld and services to help them

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Elsewhere, your name is spoken aloud in this place. 'Bolaire. Friend.' You turn to see Rulius and Calastro Mercanaud. You see that they're sitting in a private booth. One of them has moved these velvet drapes aside. You see that there is a young man who is sort of draped over their laps and you see that his eyes have rolled back in his head as he dreams in some altered narcotic state. As Rulius speaks to you, you see Calastro puts his lips near the young man's ears and sucks some vapor out of his ear as the man shudders.
segments.summary: Bolaire is called over by the Mercanaud brothers who are engaged in some form of dream/vapor extraction from a drugged victim

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: My word, this is surprising. Quite auspicious, actually. I've been meaning to get a hold of you for a while. How is bus-- How is business?
segments.summary: Bolaire greets the Mercanaud brothers and asks about their business

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Business is booming, as ever. We have some very important clients these days. Would you care to join us?
segments.summary: The Mercanaud brothers invite Bolaire to join them

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: I think, I'm actually, I'm waiting for some different company for the evening, but I can take a moment. It's interesting, are you still doing the day job, the day work, whatever you want to call it?
segments.summary: Bolaire declines to fully join but asks about their legitimate work

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Of course, we must keep up appearances.
segments.summary: The Mercanauds confirm they maintain their legitimate business front

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: I have to ask because it has been ages and there's a gala coming up, and of course, there's the new theater, which will eventually be opening, and I'm going to need a new suit, and honestly, what you wear is phenomenal. I always love what you're wearing and I would love-- I don't know, I think I would just look lovely in it.
segments.summary: Bolaire asks about commissioning a suit from the Mercanauds for upcoming events

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'd be delighted to make you a suit, Bolaire.
segments.summary: The Mercanauds agree to make Bolaire a suit

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A hand lands on your shoulder and a voice speaks and says, 'I've a room in the back ready for you.' You look up and see Aubrus Drime, a man of illicit goods that you've been talking to for some time. Something maybe he started as a normal fence working with the Crow Keepers, but he's been making a name for himself and is looking to move up into a higher class of smuggled goods.
segments.summary: Aubrus Drime approaches Bolaire for their arranged meeting

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: If you'll excuse me, gentlemen. Business calls and bespoke suits don't come cheap.
segments.summary: Bolaire excuses himself from the Mercanauds to conduct business with Aubrus

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: They close the curtains to their private area and you walk with Aubrus into another room. He's an able-bodied man, but not too terrifically tall. He's similar in proportions to yourself, but you see that he, shaved head, he's got a nick in one ear. And as you go into this private area, he turns around and says, 'Well, the money's ready. I had no idea that you worked with the likes of us.'
segments.summary: Bolaire and Aubrus enter a private room for their transaction

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh, I work with an awful lot of people, times being what they are, and who knows, maybe at some point you'll be able to afford more of my services. And I push the package towards him.
segments.summary: Bolaire delivers the package to Aubrus

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Undoing the clasps, he opens it, you see a hungry smile on his face.
segments.summary: Aubrus opens the package with anticipation

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: I begin taking the money.
segments.summary: Bolaire starts collecting payment

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Is this some kind of--
segments.summary: Aubrus begins to express confusion

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Check in the bag.
segments.summary: Bolaire tells Aubrus to check the bag

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Is this some kind of joke? Where is it?
segments.summary: Aubrus is angry that the package is empty

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Where's what?
segments.summary: Bolaire feigns ignorance

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh, you are a peach, aren't you? Listen to me. I won't be double crossed. Now, I came for a treasure. And I won't be leaving without one.
segments.summary: Aubrus threatens Bolaire over the missing treasure

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Shit.
segments.summary: Bolaire realizes he's in trouble

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What is your current HP total?
segments.summary: Combat begins as DM asks for Bolaire's HP

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: That is 26. That was a lot of dice.
segments.summary: Bolaire reports his HP and notes damage taken

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He breathes in your face and you fall immediately asleep.
segments.summary: Aubrus uses a sleep breath attack on Bolaire

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your unconscious form hits the ground-- and he pulls your mask off your body. What does he see when he pulls the mask off the body?
segments.summary: Aubrus knocks out Bolaire and removes his mask

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin)
segments.content: Oh shit. As he pulls the mask, he sees, first of all, a bit of flesh pulls like rubbered glue as it pulls off, but it doesn't stick to the mask, it just flaps back, and other than those points of contact, it is dry, cracked chunks of flesh missing to see teeth and it seems to be powdering by the second, not completely, but just the exposure to air seems to be making it turn grayer and open up. The eye sockets are practically empty, it's just flacid balloons of what used to be eyes, any moisture that was in them long gone.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes his horrific undead appearance beneath the mask

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh, the fuck. Freak. Well, won't even have to kill ya. Looks like you're on death's door.
segments.summary: Aubrus reacts with disgust to Bolaire's undead appearance

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: I can't get arms out of this. I can't do the--

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: What do we do right now?

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Give him the Heimlich. It's supposed to be--

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Somebody do something.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I know the Heimlich-- but I don't really want to touch him because he is always a little sticky.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Laura, do you know the Heimlich?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah, we had to do it, of course. Oh, but I just got my nails done.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Oh my god, they're so cute!

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: And they match my pickle!

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: They match your pickle!

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Fucking fine, I'll do it. Sam, come on.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (chokes)

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Come on. Ready, ready. One, two.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh. (grunts)

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: One more.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (grunts)

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: (coughs up object) (panting heavily) Whoa! Ooh, beautiful. Thanks, Matt. Wow.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: So you were faking it.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: No, I was genuinely choking on this incredible Czepeku battle map. And you can choke on their maps, too, because Critical Role viewers get 50% off all Czepeku subscriptions for just the first three months. I mean, just for the first three months. (laughs) There should not be a "just" in that phrase. (laughs) For three incredible months. (laughs) Just visit go.czepeku.com/critical-role, Just visit go.czepeku.com/critical-role, and score just 50-- Fuck. (laughs) Score 50% off. There's no just. 50% off thousands of beautifully crafted maps, scenes, and tokens designed to enhance your tabletop RPG adventures.
segments.summary: Sponsor ad for Czepeku battle maps

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Wow.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: New stuff added weekly. It's amazing. You guys look great. Matt, Heimlich to you.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Thank you, Sam. Our next sponsor is "Dispatch," a brand new video game from the incredible minds at AdHoc Studio, which I'm sure thought we'd be reading this-- dressed like this. Dispatch is a superhero workplace comedy starring Aaron Paul as Robert, a hero who has just retired and got stuck with the desk job that nobody wants. That's who you play. You're the one taking the calls-- dealing with over the top heroes-- trying to keep the whole operation from falling apart.
segments.summary: Sponsor ad for Dispatch video game

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: (gasps)

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: (gasps) Commitment, Matthew!

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: He's not a real carrot.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: He's not a real carrot.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: His head fell off!

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: And causing a little office drama of your own. One minute, you're cracking jokes in the break room, the next is life or death decisions. How you play and what you decide changes who's got your back and where the story-- Don't touch me!
segments.summary: Continuing Dispatch ad while dealing with costume issues

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Ah!

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Now he's a broody teen carrot.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: It's hilarious, messy, and kind of brilliant. Best of all, Travis, Laura, and I are in this game.
segments.summary: Continuing Dispatch ad

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: We're all in the game! None of us are Robert Robertson, but we're in the game.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Exactly. Dispatch is out now! So dive in at bit.ly/crdispatch to see where your choices take you.
segments.summary: Concluding Dispatch ad

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Dispatch!

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: But wait!

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: It's a really good game.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: There's more.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Oh!

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Don't miss our Dispatch One-Shot on October 30th.
segments.summary: Announcing Dispatch one-shot stream

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: No!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: That's right.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Yay!

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Oh yeah?

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Myself, Travis Willingham, Laura Bailey, Erin Yvette, and GM Jasmine Bhullar-- streaming on YouTube, Twitch, and beacon.tv at 7:00pm Pacific. Thank you, Dispatch, for sponsoring this episode.
segments.summary: Details for Dispatch one-shot stream

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Sick!

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: And we apologize.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Thanks, Dispatch.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Marisha, you're up.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Yes, I am. Our Beacon exclusive series Fireside Chat will welcome the lovable, the amazing, one of my favorite people in the whole wide world, Alex Ward! Spooky boy on October 28th at 7:00pm Pacific. So join Beacon to watch and submit questions, and get to know Alex a little better. It's a cozy time. As a reminder, Campaign 4 will take a break next week for that aforementioned Dispatch One-Shot. But we will return Thursday, November 6th with the Soldier table. And of course, if you ever need a refresher, a reminder, you can get caught up with everything Crit Role related with our Lore Keepers with our weekly Crit Recaps on critrole.com. They're great.
segments.summary: Announcements about Fireside Chat with Alex Ward, schedule, and Crit Recaps

segments.content: Ooh!

segments.content: Awesome. Laura, you're up next. Miss Pickle.

segments.content: Couldn't imagine that.

segments.content: Gotcha, gotcha. Okay. Excellent, excellent.

segments.content: Just don't talk about it.

segments.content: Great start.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Hot start.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As we begin, Julien, you are going to be first to act and I'm actually going to pass out everyone's minis!

segments.content: Ah!

segments.content: Yee!

segments.content: (laughs)

segments.content: I get to know this mini for such a short time.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Enjoy it while you can.

segments.content: -- get to you in time.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So Matt, you are going to be first to act on a 22. In the doorway, you see Lord Primus Tachonis standing there. Also, with that Divine Sense, I believe from Vaelus, the courtyard is brimming with undead just beyond the barrier of this world. So you can see that the spirits of the dead are flooding to this place just past the barrier of the living world. Essentially, you get this feeling almost like walking through some vast, frightening aquarium in the dark where but a single sheet of glass separates you from monsters of the deep.

segments.content: Mm-hmm. So you have (gasping) your sword, glancing blow. They surround you. In this moment you look, you can hear the footsteps of your companions. Your father's dead on the ground. You'll never have the opportunity for him to know you as anything other than a drunken reprobate. He would not have even known the cause of his death. It happened so quickly. And as the shades surround you, (ghastly inhale) whatever was written in their misty faces, it's gone now. The thing in Vaelus that filled them with sorrow, and guilt, and shame, no, that's not what they feel looking at you. They look at you, and those smoky mouths grin, empty sockets of shadow and lightlessness in recognition of a soul maybe just as lost as them. Maybe would be some cold comfort to invite you into their life, which some part of you has seen fit to live even as your heart still beats. They don't prepare to strike you in terror or shame. If anything, it looks like they prepare for a warm embrace.
segments.summary: Julien is surrounded by shadows after striking one. The DM describes Julien's emotional state as he sees his father's dead body, knowing he'll never have the chance to prove himself. The shadows recognize Julien as a lost soul like themselves and seem to offer an embrace rather than attack with malice.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return to the city of Dol-Makjar to the drawing room of Halandil Fang. Where you sit, Liar's Blade on your side, Thimble and Teor, Kattigan, the now itinerant Lord Wicander Halovar and Tyranny have all headed off under the stewardship of Azune to the Falcon's Rest, there to pursue Casimir, or Teor's brother, Cyd. Here in this, you bid farewell earlier to Occtis who've traveled off with Julian Davinos and Thaisha has just run off after him to make sure he's okay. Hal, it is currently just you and Murray in your home. Shadia is out with some friends. And you have just passed-- You have a letter in your hand that Thimble gave to you, which was supposed to make its way to Murray. Murray, here in this place, you have no idea about what is transpiring elsewhere across the river.

segments.content: I was really hoping to speak to Thimble. (sighs) Do you remember the day I met your brother at your house?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Insight check right now. Does he look like he's trying to come up with lies to me?
segments.summary: Hal uses insight to determine if Bolaire is being deceptive

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Insight versus either persuasion or deception.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for contested rolls

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Nat 20.
segments.summary: Bolaire rolls a natural 20

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Natural one.
segments.summary: Hal rolls a natural 1

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: lothes off of my old body, chopped my old body up, threw most of it in the fire. I have a few things just to make sure. Cleaned up, put my clothes back on, and came here for a nice shower.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I need a moment without innuendo. You and I have spoken about literature for over 200 hours over coffee in the neighborhood around The Rookery. You have attended performances where my daughter played music. I want to hear you say the words. Speak plainly and true. Who or what are you?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I'm an object created to kill a god. I am a thing. I am a mask that can be worn. I'm a mask that wears other people. I am as old as the war itself. When I'm not worn, I sleep. Minutes after the death of the trickster, I slept until the next war where I was worn and used. And then I slept and then I was worn and used, and I slept through battle after battle. And then one day, during the Falconer's Rebellion, I suddenly had the first thought that hadn't been put in my head when I was created. I had realized that the play I was written for was long over. I was a character whose play had ended and I had just been left there, waiting, just running through the motions, and I suddenly knew there must be more. And so I ran away. I saw an opportunity. I took the body that was holding me and I left. And I found my way here. I know these things. I have seen all these things.
segments.summary: Bolaire reveals his true nature as an ancient mask created to kill a god

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: This was something I was good at. This was something I could do that is not what I was made for. And I went through the motions and I didn't change really. I was just another character. And then one day, I saw one of your plays and for the first time, theater was more. And oh my god, Hal, everything you write changes everything. Knowing you has made me bigger. Watching your talent has made me capable of wanting to be more. And I don't know how to express what it is because you are the only friend I've ever had. I was ready to tell you everything before your brother, and instead, he poisoned it. And you are genuinely all I have beyond this. He's ruined my career. He's poisoned the only friendship that ever mattered to me and I will do anything to make this work, to make this better because this is the most important thing I've ever known. This theater is so important. You are so important. Your children are so important.
segments.summary: Bolaire expresses his deep friendship with Halandil and how theater changed him

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: None of that explains why he hated you.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: He didn't hate me. He thought I was a thing. He had no compulsion about treating me as--

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: You were useful to him?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I was useful and I wasn't real.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: How did he find out?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I don't know. I have my suspicions. When I was woken for the Falconer's Rebellion, I was used for some clandestine missions. Nothing I thought about, didn't think about these things, and someone must have known. I have brothers and sisters. There are more masks. They have not been found.
segments.summary: Bolaire suspects someone from the Falconer's Rebellion knew his true nature

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: For you, Hal, you remember the shattered pieces of a black ceramic mask in that coffin, in the coffin with, Murray as you know, ancient Halfling writing on it. Hal, you also remember your brother's, at times, juvenile sense of humor where he loved to put at times, juvenile sense of humor where he loved to put something literally true hidden in a euphemism.
segments.summary: Brennan reminds Halandil of clues about the mask and his brother's patterns

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Or he could be an asshole.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And you remember the last line of his letter, the one where he said, if you have that letter there, you can read that last line. It seemed a euphemism, but you begin to realize, based on what Bolaire has told you, it's not.
segments.summary: Brennan connects the brother's letter to Bolaire's revelation

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: "If you took that mask off of him, I suspect you'd have him well in hand."
segments.summary: Murray reads the revealing line from the letter

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Hal hasn't touched his wine the entire time and he drains it in one go.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Upstairs, you hear a shuffling chime of someone calling for you. One of the night curators or some docent up above, Bolaire, is calling for you.
segments.summary: Someone upstairs is calling for Bolaire

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: This is too important. I'll be--

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: Wait, wait, wait, wait. Before you leave, I want to scan this mask. It's been around for a long time. Are there any dings? Is there any imperfection on it anywhere?
segments.summary: Azune wants to examine the mask before Bolaire leaves

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Just that it was clearly handmade out of something, maybe bone, clay. The eye sockets, there is nothing. They are voids. When Bolaire blinks, it is just those little blue lights somewhere, maybe four or five inches back, the blink not the--
segments.summary: Bolaire describes the physical appearance of his mask

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Zero text, runes, language at all?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Nope.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I would show you, but I doubt you would trust.

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: No, it's okay.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: And I would show you, except this body is--

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: That's not what I'm looking for.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Ornery.

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: Bolaire, that's not what I'm looking for. And I try to find the closest thing to a nick and I'm going to cast Mending on it.
segments.summary: Azune attempts to cast Mending on a flaw in the mask

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You cast Mending. I'll say that, Taliesin, I'll allow you to determine what the effect of a Mending cast on your mask would be.
segments.summary: Brennan lets Taliesin decide the effect of the Mending spell

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Mm. Oh, interesting. I don't know. I haven't thought about that.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think in that moment as you go to cast Mending, the spell energy goes into something and you hear someone letting themselves into the archive. Not the secret part, but someone is walking around in your archives right now.
segments.summary: As the Mending spell is cast, someone enters the main archives

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Just a second, I'll make this very quick.

segments.speaker: Luis (Azune)
segments.content: And I pull back.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The intention is there. As you step up, the three of you remaining here, Bolaire, you arrive up and you see one of the benefactors of the museum. This would be Temoday Wurnst, is standing there with someone you haven't seen before. Temoday is an older man, sort of smiling. You're up here in the archives. You see some sort of dim windows out. Give me a perception check, if you'd be so kind, and--
segments.summary: Bolaire goes upstairs and encounters Temoday Wurnst and a stranger

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Shit.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Seven.
segments.summary: Bolaire rolls a 7 for perception

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Seven, great. You see that Temoday is standing there. You can look out and see that he's a rotund man with regal robes. He's standing there with another woman who you see. He goes, "Curator Bolaire, I wished to introduce you to, I know it's quite a late hour, but she has come here actually from--" And you see that woman who is dressed in resplendent white robes, middle aged, very, you know, bejeweled woman. Dark skin, braided hair wrapped around her in a crown. You see that she smiles and says, "I'm the Lady Amariya Cormoray. It is a pleasure to meet you, Curator Bolaire."
segments.summary: Lady Amariya Cormoray is introduced to Bolaire by Temoday

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Yes, hello. Hi. How may-- Good evening. I'm so sorry. I've been in the middle of so many things. What can I do for you this evening?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I'm sorry to bother you at this late hour, but I actually wished to ask you a question if I could about some of the artifacts contained in the Lloy Wing. I've been selected by the Chamber of Lords-Advisory and we are engaged in a review here and we are engaged in a review here of specifically the Pariah Blades, those that have been recovered."
segments.summary: Lady Amariya explains she's from the Chamber of Lords-Advisory reviewing the Pariah Blades

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Yes, of course. It is a bit late. Would it be possible to reschedule after I've had my beauty sleep, obviously?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "(laughs) Oh, I certainly understand, and believe me, to drag me from the comfort of my own home at this late hour is certainly a bother. Well, I'd be happy to come back another time. Would tomorrow suit you well?"

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Tomorrow would be absolutely amazing. Would you like to have a discussion about them before getting the tour or would you just prefer the tour itself?

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Wait, what's happening?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: What do we know?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Those two are gone.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: They're gone.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I feel like you guys know something I don't. Why is this? What's happening?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Well, Occtis was headed there.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh. Yeah, he's in danger. Did you guys know he's in danger? He's headed there? He's in danger.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I want--

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Thank god we have her.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: -- to put my faith in you, I want to. For the moment, I'm going to just take a leap of faith-- And the word "faith" reverberates in the back of all of your brains and I cast Aid, and the three of you, not me, the three of you gain an extra temporary five hit points for the moment.

segments.speaker: MARISHA and TALIESIN
segments.content: Ooh.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Temporary or max hit points up?

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Each target's hit point max and current hit points increases five for the duration.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: So it's not--

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: For eight hours until you lose it.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: So, max goes up.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Max goes up.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Five hit points. Oh!

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: With that, I was about to ask if you felt unsafe, but that tells me everything I need to know, and I'm casting False Life on myself.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay. You also know, Hal, that Thaisha was headed there.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Yeah, Primus was looking for Occtis. I was trying to get to this. This was literally the whole impetus of us going out tonight.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: There's a lot.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Did you guys already know this? Son of a bitch! No one tells me anything! Let's go!

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Wait.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great, where are you headed?

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: To the-- Let's--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great. The four of you head off into the night as fast as you can.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: To the Palazzo!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You guys arrive some, you know, 20 or 30 minutes later.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: We don't come in banging pots and pans, though.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Right.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: The place is blacking out.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: It's already done that.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes. You arrive. As you arrive, you arrive at the Palazzo Davinos. Do you want to give me any skill checks upon arriving there?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I can see, I will just say immediately that I can see in complete darkness, including magical darkness, so I am trying to get in front of everybody.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I'll immediately know-- You said Thaisha was here? Hey, hey!

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yes, she went with the boy.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: All right, I'm going to send a Message to Thaisha.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: I will have on my way time to Detect Magic ritual so that it's activated by the time we get here.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Oh, yeah. Mage Armor.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Mage Armor, Detect Magic, and you're casting what now, Message?

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Message.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay, great.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Thaisha.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I stand behind the three of them.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That's my skill.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: I'm right at your side.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You have Detect Magic on?

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: I have Detect Magic on.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me investigation or arcana checks.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I will do an arcana check. Ugh!

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: I would like to use a Luck point.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, go for it.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Oh my god. 12.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: 19 for arcana.

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Natural one. I've been very distracted. Shit has gone tits up today. Jesus.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Eight investigation.

segments.speaker: LUIS
segments.content: A lot.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Eight investigation. You have a 19 arcana.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You guys arrive at the Palazzo Davinos. The gates open. Beautiful garden.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I send that Message to Thaisha. Once again, I get a--

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That's not how that works at all.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: No, nothing coming back.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Nothing?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You walk into the main hall. It's absolutely deserted.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: nwood trees. So that really thick knot, that shreddy trunks of the tree. They get very dull gray and very hard easily. So it's just two very specific kinds of trees that don't appear anywhere else in the city.
segments.summary: Brennan describes unique trees in the Lloy garden

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: That's amazing.
segments.summary: Marisha appreciates the description

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: This beautiful garden with these red ginkgo trees, these trees that seem vibrant, and not only alive, but at the ready. There is a power of readiness here, and as you move through this place, you see there are also, throughout the gardens, these large boulders that stand almost like places of meditation. Many of them have worn seats smooth up high for someone to go meditate or pray or be at peace within, and the boulders have veins of rich copper and iron and metals running through them. Here in this place, you see the Lloy family estate. A lot of the Lloys moved to Dol-Rungja away from here, but I think you see, tending to this place, there's only one or two, and they're not even really-- Your family doesn't have attendants, but it's like, oh, there's a neighbor that you guys have known for your whole lifetimes that you paid, that you take care of some of their stuff, and they come and watch for you. You see this old orcish man, Rohor, has made this little lantern. He's come in. Aranessa is there. Vaelus, Julien. Thaisha, where is Occtis' body?
segments.summary: Detailed description of the Lloy family garden and estate, introduction of Rohor

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: There's no universe in which I put it down.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms she's still carrying Occtis's body

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You're just holding it?
segments.summary: Brennan clarifies Thaisha's actions

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: So I'm holding it, and I think, at this point, I'm out of spell slots. I've been pumping Cure Wounds into his corpse the entire time.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains she's been casting healing spells on Occtis's corpse

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's like a heartbeat. It's CPR.
segments.summary: Thaisha describes her desperate healing attempts

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: His body, with those Cure Wounds, all of the vitality has drained from him, running through city streets with this body, viscera missing, but you-- You've effectively mended him, not healed him. The wound is still fully open on his midsection, and there's a smell of iron in the air from the blood, but the gashes from the ghouls, the tear of the garotte, that's healed. Lifeless. Aranessa stands nearby, gazing on. Where are Vaelus and Julien here in the garden?
segments.summary: Description of Occtis's partially healed but lifeless body

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I think Julien is keeping a vigilant watch in case any of these entities have followed, and is using that task to keep him from really facing the reality that's right over his shoulder.
segments.summary: Julien keeps watch to avoid confronting the death

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Vaelus is also keeping watch and watching Thaisha just keep trying to bring back Occtis, and just taking everybody in.
segments.summary: Vaelus observes Thaisha's desperate attempts

segments.speaker: Aranessa (DM)
segments.content: Do you know what they did to him?
segments.summary: Aranessa asks about what happened to Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I think this is the first time she realizes she has no idea what happened and didn't even think to-- she has no idea what happened and didn't even think to-- Didn't think to think about it. It was just the life of him, and I think in that moment, will start ritually casting Detect Magic. No, I don't know.
segments.summary: Thaisha realizes she doesn't know what happened and casts Detect Magic

segments.speaker: Aranessa (DM)
segments.content: I-- Those corpses in the room threw me to the ground. I saw, only in the mad dash of horror, they threw him on the table. One of those monsters sat a bit of wire around his neck, pulling him down, and his brother plunging a knife into him, and then when I opened the door, the brother was holding a object up in his hand, a stone, a carved stone with wings.
segments.summary: Aranessa describes witnessing Occtis's murder by his brother Ethrand

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: And my eyes immediately snap to Vaelus. Could that have been?
segments.summary: Thaisha looks to Vaelus about the stone

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: It could have been. They put this stone.
segments.summary: Vaelus confirms the stone's significance

segments.speaker: Aranessa (DM)
segments.content: He had it in his hand and he was holding it while he killed your friend. They were brothers, the Tachonis. The Tachonis have-- They have been silent for so long. They've been silent for so long. They've been silent for so long.
segments.summary: Aranessa reveals the brothers' identity and their family's silence

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: He was killed by his own brother.
segments.summary: Vaelus states the tragic reality

segments.speaker: Aranessa (DM)
segments.content: He had a, I saw him. I thought he had it in his hand.
segments.summary: Aranessa continues describing what she witnessed

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: He didn't have the stone. When I saw him in the hallway, he was holding something else covered in blood. Was I able to assess that it was his heart?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks about what Ethrand was holding

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I mean, you were in wolf form and I think on an instinctual level, you know that was a heart.
segments.summary: Brennan confirms Thaisha would know it was a heart

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Ethrand took his heart.
segments.summary: Thaisha realizes Ethrand took Occtis's heart

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The Detect Magic finishes. The most potent divine necromancy comes radiating in waves from something buried in this boy's chest.
segments.summary: Detect Magic reveals powerful necromancy in Occtis's chest

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't mean to do it, but I am repulsed. I push the body and start backing away until I hit a tree.
segments.summary: Thaisha recoils from the magical detection

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: What's wrong?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks about Thaisha's reaction

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: There's something in him. He put something in him.
segments.summary: Thaisha reveals something was placed inside Occtis

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Well, what does that mean?
segments.summary: Bolaire asks for clarification

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Walking in from outside, you see coming in from the gate, Hal, Bolaire, Azune, and Murray walk with Rohor. You see Rohor looks up and says, 'It's Hal.'
segments.summary: The rest of the group arrives at the garden

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I was shouting on the grounds, and once I found Rohor, followed him and I see you standing over this boy and like a parent, irrationally in a flash, see Alogar, our son, on the ground and blink and it's this young man that you've been traveling with, and I run past him and I catch you.
segments.summary: Halandil rushes to comfort Thaisha, momentarily seeing their son

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: She dissolves in your arms. He died. I need to do something.
segments.summary: Thaisha breaks down in Halandil's arms

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Easy, easy.
segments.summary: Halandil comforts Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I couldn't save him. I couldn't stop it and
segments.summary: Thaisha expresses her guilt and grief

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Was this Primus?
segments.summary: Murray asks about Primus's involvement

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes. He killed Julien's father, too.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms Primus killed both Occtis and Julien's father

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: Is there still a shadow on Julien? I'm going to walk over to Julien. You're different. There's something attached to you. Something wrong. I'm so sorry. It's going to have to be dealt with. I'm going to walk over to the body.
segments.summary: Bolaire notices something wrong with Julien and approaches the body

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: And I'll go with you.
segments.summary: Murray joins Bolaire

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Yeah, me too.
segments.summary: Azune also approaches

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: You may not want to watch this.
segments.summary: Bolaire warns others about what he's about to do

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: What are you going to do?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks about Bolaire's intentions

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: You said there's something in him.
segments.summary: Bolaire references what Thaisha detected

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I repeat my question.
segments.summary: Thaisha insists on knowing what Bolaire plans

segments.speaker: Bolaire (Taliesin)
segments.content: I'm going to go looking for it.
segments.summary: Bolaire explains he's going to search inside the body

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Why don't you all tell us what happened first?
segments.summary: Halandil asks for the full story

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: We don't know.
segments.summary: Vaelus admits they don't know the full story

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Let's also remember the last time that one of us touched something of great arcane power. It did not go well.
segments.summary: Murray warns about touching magical artifacts

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Gravity? The inevitability of--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: [rumbling]

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: The fuck?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: -- objects to come into contact. (huffs)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You all hear a gasp, not only from yours, as the ground shakes.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: I forgot.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You hear a gasp. You hear a gasp from Occtis Tachonis. Alex, would you come to the table, please?
segments.summary: Occtis Tachonis awakens

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Is there a chair?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Oh. We need a chair.

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Here, here, here. Here, here, here, here, here.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You go.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Invite him in. It's right behind you. It's behind you.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Occtis.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Yes?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You wake up dead.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: (huffs) What happened?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I move from a fully in Hal's embrace to just tackle this dude. (shouts) You're dead!
segments.summary: Thaisha tackles Occtis

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: I am.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: You okay? Are you okay?

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: There's still a hole in the chest.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: You all right? You all right?

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Everything's still open, right?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your viscera are absolutely open, your innards are fully exposed, and you see that they begin to wriggle and writhe. (slurps)
segments.summary: Occtis's wounds are still open and healing

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Oh god.

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson (Marisha Ray)
segments.content: Ugh!

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Bodies do do that.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Get your hand out of my stomach before it closes.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, oh.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see that leaping from your viscera, (yips) Pincushion lands on your chest.
segments.summary: Pincushion emerges from Occtis's body

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: That was a rollercoaster.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It was a rollercoaster.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: That was a rollercoaster!

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Beans.
